intro: Erysimum cheiranthus subsp. pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf wallflower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, often blooming from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. This subspecies is valued for its hardiness and ornamental appeal in horticulture.
